page.title: 01Warham and Wighton
page.content: Wighton approximately 200 inhabitants. Main employment arable and dairy farming. Rises either side of River Stiffkey. Large Parish church (tower rebuilt 1976) Methodist church, post office stores, public house, village hall, playing field. Three parcels common land and parish allotments. Children bussed into Wells school. Sports, football, cricket, hockey. committees, Parish council, charity trustees, womens institute, parochial church council. 111 houses, private council & Holkham Estate. 82% occupied 14% holiday. Street lighting. Sparse public transport. Warham 150 electors in 81 houses, pub at crossroads centre of village, above(ss) old deciduous trees and All Saints Church, 400 years W St Marys Church, village hall between, 20 council houses built 1947,
